intro: Tacsonia glaberrima var. loxensis, commonly known as the Loxense Tacsonia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous foliage and striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests. Its flowers are adapted for pollination by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
